document_data.name: Grilyanthyn
document_data.mainbody: [[Church of Kossuth#Organization|Most Fervid Fire]] '''Grilyanthyn of Thay''' was a [[Thay]]an [[fire]] [[elementalist]] and [[priest]] of [[Kossuth]] active in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].{{Cite organized play/LC/The Quest for Fire|17}}{{Cite organized play/LC/The Quest for Fire|10}}
document_data.Description: Grilyanthyn was a bulky [[human]] man who stood {{SI|5'8|'"|c|long=yes}} tall.
document_data.Personality:
Grilyanthyn aspired to be accepted by Kossuth as one of his [[specialty priest]]s. He had a genius-level intellect.

He preferred to avoid combat, dressing in disguise if needed and fleeing if attacked. His preferred tactic was to use a combination of ''[[invisibility]]'' and either ''[[air walk]]'' or ''[[fly]]'' to escape his enemies. If forced to fight, he favored spells like ''[[burning hands]]'', ''[[cause blindness]]'', ''[[cause deafness]]'', ''[[hold person]]'', ''[[fireball]]'', ''[[magic missile]]'', and ''[[slay living]]''.
document_data.History:
Grilyanthyn was a resident of the [[Flaming Brazier]], the most notable temple of Kossuth in Thay,{{Cite organized play/LC/The Quest for Fire|3}} and held the rank of "Most Fervid Fire" within the [[Kossuthan]] clergy.<ref group="note">While his affiliation with the Order of Crimson Warlocks is not stated in ''[[The Quest for Fire]]'', he fits the description of a member given that he is a [[wizard]] with the rank of "Most Fervid Fire".

When a Kossuthan [[curse]] struck [[Procampur]] in an apparent show of Kossuth's displeasure over the construction of a [[Shrine of Istishia (Procampur)|shrine]] to [[Istishia]], Grilyanthyn traveled to the city in hopes that he could witness his god's wrath and prove his worthiness by destroying the shrine.{{Cite organized play/LC/The Quest for Fire|4}} He falsely believed that the curse was an invitation for him to show his power.
